„Äê

#‚Äã701 ‚Äî August 22, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Regexes Got Good: The History (and Future) of Regular Expressions in JavaScript ‚Äî Regular expression support was always a little underwhelming in JS, but things have improved. Steven takes us on a tour to refresh our knowledge, as well as show off his ‚Äòregex‚Äô library that boosts JS regexes to a true A++ rating. Steven was co-author of O‚ÄôReilly‚Äôs Regular Expressions Cookbook and High Performance JavaScript so knows his¬†stuff.

Steven Levithan

WorkOS: The Modern Identity Platform for B2B¬†SaaS ‚Äî WorkOS is a modern identity platform for B2B SaaS, offering flexible and easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes instead of months. It's trusted by hundreds of high-growth startups such as Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, and¬†Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

Node v22.7.0 (Current) Released ‚Äî Node 22.6 let you strip types from source code, but now with --experimental-transform-types you can transform TypeScript-only syntax into JavaScript before running it too. Module syntax detection is now also enabled by¬†default.

Rafael Gonzaga

Bun v1.1.25: Now Running at 1.29 Million Requests per Second ‚Äî I‚Äôm having a little fun with the title, but the latest version of the JavaScriptCore-based JS runtime has added node:cluster support and uses this to demo a high level of HTTP throughput on a ‚ÄòHello World‚Äô example. Support for V8‚Äôs C++ API has also landed ‚Äì notable because Bun isn‚Äôt V8-based.

Ashcon Partovi

IN BRIEF:

  • We've mentioned ECMASCript 2024 a bit recently, but Pawel Grzybek has a neat and tidy overview of what's new in the ES2024¬†spec.

  • üêù Could Wasp be 'the JavaScript answer to Django' for full-stack webdev? The Wasp team certainly thinks so.

  • üéôÔ∏è Ryan Dahl, creator of both Node.js and Deno, went on the Stack Overflow podcast to talk about Deno's current limitations and what's coming in Deno 2.0.

RELEASES:

  • PlayCanvas Engine 2.0 ‚Äì A powerful JS-based Web graphics¬†platform.

  • Node v20.17.0 (LTS) ‚Äì The LTS release of Node adds support for require-ing synchronous ESM¬†graphs.

  • Astro 4.14 ‚Äì The popular agnostic content site framework now includes an experimental API for managing site¬†content.

  • pnpm 9.8, Vuetify 3.7, Neo.mjs 7.0

Join Us for ViteConf on October 3rd ‚Äî Learn how the best teams are building the next generation of the web with¬†Vite!

StackBlitz sponsor

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

50 TypeScript F--k Ups Mistakes ‚Äî An admittedly colorfully-titled book digging into lots of subtle mistakes you might run into with TypeScript. It‚Äôs available on Leanpub in PDF, iPad, and Kindle forms, or you can read it all directly on its GitHub¬†repo. At least worth a skim in case you're running into any of its¬†points..

Azat Mardan

The Official Redux Essentials Tutorial, Redux ‚Äî The long standing guide to how to use the popular Redux state container the right way with best practices has undergone a big reworking with TypeScript used throughout, new concepts added, and more coverage of RTK/React Toolkit¬†features.

Redux Team

React is (Becoming) a Full-Stack Framework ‚Äî Is React merely a frontend library? How does the backend fit in? The author shares his thoughts on what led him to start considering React as more of a full-stack¬†solution.

Robin Wieruch

üìÑ Using JavaScript Generators to Visualize Algorithms Alexander G. Covic

üìÑ Optimizing SPA Load Times with Async Chunks Preloading Matteo Mazzarolo

üìÑ Using isolatedModules in Angular 18.2 Thompson and Lyding (Angular Team)

üìÑ How to Generate a PDF in a JavaScript App Colby Fayock

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Milkdown: Plugin-Driven WYSIWYG Markdown Editor Framework ‚Äî A lightweight WYSIWYG Markdown editor based around a plugin system that enables a significant level of customization. It‚Äôs neat to see the docs are rendered by the editor itself. GitHub¬†repo.

Mirone

Fuite 5.0: A Tool for Finding Memory Leaks in Web Apps ‚Äî A CLI tool that you can point at a URL to analyze for memory leaks. Here‚Äôs how it works. There‚Äôs also a video¬†tutorial.

Nolan Lawson

‚úÇÔ∏è Cut Your QA Cycles Down to Minutes with Automated Testing ‚Äî Are slow test cycles limiting your dev teams' release velocity? QA Wolf provides high-volume, high-speed test coverage for web and mobile apps ‚Äî reducing your test cycles to minutes. Learn¬†more.

QA Wolf sponsor

LogTape: Simple Logging Library with Zero Dependencies ‚Äî I‚Äôm digging this new style of library that promises support across all the main runtimes (Node, Deno, Bun) as well as edge functions and the browser¬†devtools.

Hong Minhee

üìä¬†Chart.js 4.4: Canvas-Based Charts for the Web ‚Äî One of those libraries that feels like it‚Äôs been around forever but still looks fresh and gets good updates. Bar, line, area, bubble, pie, donut, scatter, and radar charts are all a piece of cake to render. Samples and GitHub¬†repo.

Chart.js Contributors

Legend State: A Tiny, Fast and Modern React State System ‚Äî A year ago, Jack Herrington wondered if Legend State could be ‚ñ∂Ô∏è ‚Äòthe ultimate state manager‚Äô and things have progressed a lot since, with it now boasting being the fastest React state library in¬†town.

Jay Meistrich

Tagger: Zero Dependency, Vanilla JavaScript Tagging Library ‚Äî You can play with a live demo¬†here.

Jakub T. Jankiewicz

tinykeys 3.0: A Keybindings Library in ~650 Bytes ‚Äî Keeps things as simple and sweet as¬†possible.

Jamie Kyle

heic-to: Convert HEIC/HEIF Images to JPEG or PNG in the Browser

Hopper Gee

  • Cheerio 1.0 ‚Äì HTML/XML manipulation library for¬†Node.

  • üé® Chroma.js 3.0 ‚Äì JavaScript color manipulation¬†library.

  • eta (Œ∑) 3.5 ‚Äì Embedded JS template engine for Node, Deno, and¬†browsers.

  • Embla Carousel 8.2 ‚Äì Carousel library with fluid motion and good swipe¬†precision.

  • d3-graphviz 5.6 ‚Äì Graphviz DOT rendering and animated¬†transitions.

  • Alpine AJAX 0.9 ‚Äì Alpine.js plugin for building server-powered¬†frontends.

  • Happy DOM 15.0 ‚Äì JS implementation of a web browser sans¬†UI.

  • Elliptic 6.5.7 ‚Äì Elliptic curve cryptography in plain¬†JS.

  • Poku 2.5 ‚Äì Cross-platform JavaScript test¬†runner.

üíö Use Node? Check out the latest issue of Node Weekly, our sibling email about all things relating to Node.js ‚Äî from tutorials and screencasts to news and releases. We do include some Node related items here in JavaScript Weekly, but we save most of it for there.

‚Üí Check out Node¬†Weekly

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã700 ‚Äî August 15, 2024

Read on the Web

üëã Wow, issue 700! We're back after a week away. Technically I'm still on vacation, but I didn't want to leave you in the lurch for too long.. ;-)
__
Peter Cooper, your editor

JavaScript Weekly

ECMAScript Safe Assignment Operator Proposal ‚Äî We often feature ECMAScript proposals that are in their later stages, but how about a brand new one you could get involved with? This one proposes an interesting additional bit of language syntax (?=) that returns a [error, value] tuple from an¬†assignment.

Arthur Fiorette

Crafting a 13KB Game: The Story of Space Huggers ‚Äî We always love Frank‚Äôs dives into how he produces neat JavaScript experiments and, in this case, a complete game in just 13KB ‚Äî and if it inspires you, the latest js13kGames game development competition has just started.

Frank Force

WorkOS: The Modern Identity Platform for B2B¬†SaaS ‚Äî WorkOS is a modern identity platform for B2B SaaS, offering flexible and easy-to-use APIs to integrate SSO, SCIM, and RBAC in minutes instead of months. It's trusted by hundreds of high-growth startups such as Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, and¬†Webflow.

WorkOS sponsor

Google's Angular Lead Sees Convergence in JavaScript Frameworks ‚Äî ‚ÄúWhen picking a framework, don‚Äôt overthink it. It will end up being the same technology anyway with a different facade.‚Äù Minko Gechev talks about leading the way in converging Google‚Äôs Angular and Wiz¬†frameworks.

Loraine Lawson (The New Stack)

Announcing Official Puppeteer Support for Firefox ‚Äî As of version 23, Google‚Äôs originally Chrome-only Puppeteer browser automation library now has first-class support for Firefox¬†too.

Mozilla Hacks

IN BRIEF:

  • ‚≠ê If you've wondered why so many new npm packages are spam these days, it may be because of 'Tea'. Though not the drinking¬†kind..

  • Brendan Eich has expressed his support for the currently stage 1 Decimal draft proposal for bringing a more precise decimal number representation to JavaScript.

  • There's an early technical preview of React Native WebGPU. William Candillon shows it off in ‚ñ∂Ô∏è¬†this 9-minute screencast.

RELEASES:

  • jQuery UI 1.14.0 ‚Äì The legacy effects and widgets library reduces support for older¬†browsers.

  • Madge 8.0 ‚Äì Create graphs of module¬†dependencies.

  • React Native 0.75, Angular 18.2, Bun 1.1.23, ESLint 9.9

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Patterns for Memory Efficient DOM Manipulation ‚Äî Marc shares a solid look at the best practices to employ in order to avoid excess memory usage when managing/updating the DOM, all with a hope to make your apps faster. A good overview of the core principles behind DOM manipulation and¬†optimization.

Marc Grabanski

'How I Won $2,750 using JavaScript, AI, and a Can of WD-40' ‚Äî This is far from a technical JavaScript article, but it‚Äôs a fun story, involves some code and statistics, and ultimately might make you¬†laugh.

Dave Kiss

Breakpoints and console.log Is the Past, Time Travel Is the Future ‚Äî 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, node:test, and more. Huge changes are coming in Wallaby 2.0! Stay tuned.¬†üöÄ

Wallaby Team sponsor

Common Causes of Memory Leaks in JavaScript ‚Äî Filled with basic examples oriented around V8-based runtimes like Node.js and¬†Deno.

Trevor Indrek Lasn

Learn Web Components ‚Äî If you‚Äôre looking to scrub on your Web Components know-how, this road map should prove useful. It‚Äôs a collection of good third party articles covering a wide range of¬†knowledge.

Andrico Karoulla

A Tale of Evading JavaScript Anti-Debugging Techniques ‚Äî When debugging code written by a third party, there could be some traps thrown in your way to prevent your usual debugging techniques. What to do? Revisiting a popular article from¬†2023.

Veritas

Fine-Grained Reactivity in Svelte 5 ‚Äî Taking a close look at Svelte‚Äôs new so-called fine-grained¬†reactivity.

Adam Rackis

üìÑ Tips for Using React Testing Library to Write Unit Tests Pavan Policherla

üìÑ 45 VS Code Shortcuts for Boosting Your Productivity Shahed Nasser

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

Volta 2.0: Install and Run JavaScript Tools Quickly ‚Äî A long-standing Rust powered tool for installing and switching JavaScript related tools (like Node, TypeScript, Yarn, etc.) ‚Ä¶ ‚Äúno matter the package manager, Node runtime, or OS.‚Äù GitHub¬†repo.

Volta

Floating UI: Positioning for Tooltips, Popovers, Dropdowns, etc. ‚Äî A library to create ‚Äòfloating‚Äô elements such as tooltips, popovers, and dropdowns. Essentially a next-gen Popper which it now officially¬†succeeds.

atomiks

üòò Kiss Bugs Goodbye ‚Äî Get 80% automated E2E web and mobile app coverage in under four months with QA Wolf . With QA cycles complete in minutes (not days), bugs don‚Äôt stand a chance. Schedule a¬†demo.

QA Wolf sponsor

React Figma: Use Components as a Source for Figma Designs ‚Äî A lot of folks use Figma to mock up designs for their React components, but what about the other way around? Use React components as a source for your designs in¬†Figma! GitHub repo.

Ilya Lesik

  • Ky 1.6 ‚Äì Simple HTTP client based upon Fetch for browsers, Node¬†&¬†Deno.

  • True Myth 8.0 ‚Äì Safe, idiomatic null and error handling in TypeScript with Maybe and¬†Result¬†types.

  • Protobuf-ES 2.0 ‚Äì Fully compliant Protobuf implementation for¬†JS/TS.

  • üïπÔ∏è Kontra 10.0 ‚Äì Lightweight gaming micro-library, optimized for js13kGames.

  • express-validator 7.2 ‚Äì Express.js middleware for¬†validator.js.

  • jscodeshift 17.0 ‚Äì JavaScript codemod toolkit from Facebook.

  • üåç Turf.js 7.1 ‚Äì Modular geospatial analysis engine.

  • Marked 14.0 ‚Äì Fast Markdown compiler¬†/¬†parser.

item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã702 ‚Äî August 29, 2024

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Rspack 1.0: The Rust-Powered JavaScript Bundler ‚Äî Far from being ‚Äòyet another bundler‚Äô with its own approach and terminology to learn, Rspack prides itself on being webpack API and ecosystem compatible, while offering many times the performance. The team now considers it production ready and encourages you to try your webpack-based projects on¬†it.

Rspack Contributors

üí° Rspack also has a family of ancillary tools worth checking out, such as Rsdoctor, a tool for analyzing and visualizing your build process (for both Rspack and webpack!)

Front-End System Design ‚Äî Learn to create scalable, efficient user interfaces in this extensive video course by Evgennii Ray. Explore the box model, browser rendering, DOM manipulation, state management, performance and much¬†more.

Frontend Masters sponsor

How to Create an NPM Package in 2024 ‚Äî Sounds simple, but there are a lot of steps involved if you want to follow best practices, introduce useful tools, and get things just right. Matt Pocock walks through the process here, and there‚Äôs a 14-minute screencast too, if you‚Äôd prefer to¬†watch¬†along.

Matt Pocock

IN BRIEF:

  • ü§ñ v0 is an AI-powered tool from Vercel for, originally, generating shadcn/ui-powered React components based upon prompts you supply. Now, however, it has basic Vue.js support too.

  • Deno 1.46 has been released and promises to be the final 1.x release before the much awaited Deno 2.0. Deno's Node compatibility improves even more (it now supports Playwright and many more things) and ships with V8 12.9.

  • üìä IEEE has published its latest annual list of top programming languages. JavaScript takes third place, but TypeScript has leapt up several places¬†to¬†fourth.

RELEASES:

  • Prisma 5.19 ‚Äì The popular ORM for Node.js and¬†TypeScript adds 'TypedSQL', a way to write raw SQL queries in a type-safe¬†way.

  • üìà billboard.js 3.13 ‚Äì Popular D3 chart library adds area-step-range¬†charts.

  • pnpm 9.9 ‚Äì Fast, space efficient package¬†manager.

  • React Email 3.0, Ember 5.11, Bun v1.1.26

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

JS Dates are About to Be Fixed ‚Äî Handling dates and times is famously a painful area for programmers and JavaScript hasn‚Äôt done a lot to make it easier. Libraries like Moment.js help a lot, but Iago looks at how the Temporal proposal and its features will begin to help a lot more over¬†time.

Iago Lastra

Weekly Chats on the Art and Practice of Programming ‚Äî Your home for weekly conversations with fascinating guests about how technology is made and¬†where it‚Äôs¬†headed.

The Stack Overflow Podcast sponsor

JavaScript Generators Explained ‚Äî Jan was frustrated by the quality of documentation and articles explaining generators in JavaScript, and set out to explain things in a way that a more advanced developer could¬†appreciate.

Jan Hesters

Implementing a React-a-Like from Scratch ‚Äî While it's unlikely you'll actually want to do this, at least thinking about it can prove instructive as to what‚Äôs going on in React‚Äôs engine¬†room.

Robby Pruzan

‚ñ∂¬†¬†How to Implement the 2048 Game in JavaScript ‚Äî Ania is back with one of her usual easy to follow walkthroughs of implementing a complete game in JavaScript. This time it‚Äôs the 2048 sliding puzzle game. (Two weeks ago she did Tic-Tac-Toe as¬†well.)

Ania Kub√≥w

Learn Role-Based Access Control and Simplify Permissions¬†Management ‚Äî Enhance security and streamline access by managing user roles with Clerk¬†Organizations.

Clerk sponsor

üìÑ The Only Widely Recognized JS Feature Ever Deprecated ‚Äì Spoiler: It‚Äôs with. Trevor Lasn

üìÑ Generating Unique Random Numbers in JavaScript Using Sets Amejimaobari

üì∫ 21 Talks from the Chain React 2024 Conference ‚Äì A React Native event. YouTube

üìÑ Exposing Internal Methods on Vue Custom Elements Jaime Jones

üìÑ The Interface Segregation Principle in React Alex Kondov

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

TypeScript 5.6 Release Candidate ‚Äî As always, Daniel presents an epic roundup of what‚Äôs new. We‚Äôll focus more on it next week though, as the final release is anticipated to land next Tuesday (September¬†3).

Daniel Rosenwasser (Microsoft)

Vuestic UI 1.10: A Vue.js 3.0 UI Framework ‚Äî Features 60 customizable and responsive components and with the v1.10 release it‚Äôs gained a significant bundle size optimization, a custom compiler that improves build time performance, and other minor enhancements. GitHub¬†repo.

Vuestic UI

‚úÖ Bye Bye Bugs ‚Äî Get 80% automated E2E test coverage for mobile and web apps in under 4 months with QA Wolf. With QA cycles complete in minutes (not days), bugs don‚Äôt stand a chance. Schedule a¬†demo.

QA Wolf sponsor

Material¬†UI v6: The Popular React UI Design/Component System ‚Äî At ten years old, the popular design system has its latest major release. There's a focus on improved theming, color scheme management, container queries, and React 19 support. There are revamped templates to be inspired¬†by,¬†too.

Garc√≠a, Bittu, Andai, et al.

npm-check-updates 17.0: Update package.json Dependencies to Latest Versions ‚Äî That is, as opposed to the specified versions. It includes a handy -i interactive mode so you can look at potential upgrades and then opt in to them one by¬†one.

Raine Revere

Code Hike 1.0: Turn Markdown into Rich Interactive Experiences ‚Äî Aimed at use cases like code walkthroughs and interactive docs, Code Hike bridges the gap between Markdown and React when creating technical content that takes full advantage of the modern¬†web.

Rodrigo Pombo

Calendar.js: A Calendar Control with Drag and Drop ‚Äî A responsive calendar with no dependencies, full drag and drop support (even between calendars), and many ways to manage events with recurring events, exporting, holidays, and¬†more.

William Troup

  • üìä Perspective 3.0 ‚Äì Data visualization and analytics component. The core is written in C++ and compiled to WebAssembly where it can be used from¬†JavaScript. Their homepage shows it off well with a live example.

  • json-viewer 3.5 ‚Äì Display JSON data in a readable, user-friendly¬†way.

  • ‚ôüÔ∏è Stockfish.js 16.1 ‚Äì A JavaScript chess engine.

  • jest-dom 6.5 ‚Äì Jest matchers to test DOM¬†state.

  • Marked 14.1 ‚Äì Fast Markdown compiler¬†/¬†parser.

  • Javet 3.1.5 ‚Äì Java + V8. Embed JS into¬†Java.

  • Pixi.js 8.3.4 ‚Äì Fast 2D on WebGL¬†engine.

It's trusted by hundreds of high-growth startups such as Perplexity, Vercel, Drata, and¬†Webflow.

  • Bye NgModules, the future of Angular is standalone! Angular v19 will make standalone: true the default for components, directives, and pipes. This is already the recommended best practice,¬†however.

  • Angular's product lead, Minko Gechev, has also shared a little about what it means to mange the Angular project.

  • OpenAI has switched ChatGPT from Next.js to a Remix-based app, according to Remix's Ryan Florence on X.

  • üáµüá± Poland's WarsawJS community is holding a 10th anniversary meetup on September 11. They invite you to ‚ñ∂Ô∏è watch live on YouTube.

Sentry sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Behind the Scenes: The Making of VS Code ‚Äî A detailed conversation with two of the popular editor's principal engineers on what makes it tick. VS Code is surely one of the world's most widely distributed JavaScript-powered apps.

Holland, Rieken and Pasero (Microsoft)

Shenzilong

Leave Forms to SurveyJS and Get Back to What You Love Coding ‚Äî Extensible JavaScript libraries for form management. Drag-and-drop UI, JSON form definitions, and seamless integration with any backend for full data¬†control.

SurveyJS sponsor

Exploring Goja: A Go-Powered JavaScript Runtime ‚Äî Goja is a pure Go(lang) JS runtime that makes it possible to embed JS into Go¬†apps.

JT Archie

Tapas Adhikary

Pavel Romanov

üìÑ A Complete Guide to Beginning with JavaScript ‚Äì A rather epic article packed with background knowledge, context, and third party resources for starting a modern JavaScript learning¬†journey. Cody Lindley

Kevin Decker

Redwood v8.0 Released ‚Äî A long standing, opinionated React & GraphQL (and/or RSC) full-stack framework that covers all the bases for professional dev teams with best-in-class tool support. v8.0 introduces a background jobs system, Docker support, and easier SSR and RSC¬†setup.

Redwood Team

Tests Are Dead. Meticulous Is Here ‚Äî Automatically creates & maintains E2E UI tests. Zero flakes. Backed by YC, CTO of GitHub, CPO of Adobe, CEO of¬†Vercel.

Meticulous sponsor

Sasha Shpota

Typist 7.0: Tiptap-Based Rich Text Editor Component ‚Äî Simple and opinionated. You can try several examples in the sidebar. Well suited for basic rich text situations like writing comments or messages and has a single-line¬†mode.

Belt: A New Tool for Starting React Native Apps ‚Äî A CLI tool for starting a new React Native app that takes various mundane decisions away from you and uses tooling and conventions established by a productive app development¬†team.
